event: First human settlements by Archaic peoples.
Island inhabited by Arawak people, later displaced by Kalinago (Caribs).
Christopher Columbus sights the island on November 3 during his second voyage.
France claims Dominica but faces resistance from the indigenous Kalinago people.
Treaty of Paris grants Britain control of Dominica after the Seven Years' War.
France briefly recaptures Dominica during the American Revolutionary War.
Treaty of Paris restores Dominica to Britain.
Slavery abolished in the British Empire; Dominica becomes the first British Caribbean colony to have a Black-controlled legislature.
Black majority in the legislature removed by Britain amid tensions and reforms.
Dominica joins the West Indies Federation.
Federation dissolves; Dominica reverts to British control as an associated state.
Dominica gains full independence from the United Kingdom on November 3.
Hurricane David causes widespread destruction and loss of life.
Mary Eugenia Charles becomes Prime Minister, the first female elected leader in the Caribbean.
Tropical Storm Jeanne causes flooding and damage.
Tropical Storm Erika causes significant damage to infrastructure and economy.
Hurricane Maria devastates Dominica, destroying 90% of buildings and displacing thousands.
COVID-19 pandemic hits Dominica’s tourism and economic sectors.
